To je najmanjša kamera na svetu

02 Nov 2019, 11:10











Najmanjša kamera na svetu OmniVision OV6948 meri zgolj 0,575 x 0,575 x 0,232 milimetrov.

Ameriškemu podjetju OmniVision je nedavno uspelo nekaj, kar je še pred kratkim veljalo za nemogoče. Njihovi inženirji so namreč pripravili endoskopsko kamero, ki je komajda večja od zrna peska. Najmanjša kamera na svetu OmniVision OV6948 namreč meri zgolj 0,575 x 0,575 x 0,232 milimetrov in je opremljena s slikovnim tipalo ločljivosti 40 tisoč slikovnih točk. Novost nudi ločljivost 200 x 200 slikovnih točk ter nudi hitrost zajema slik do 30 sličic na sekundo s 120 stopinjskim vidnim kotom.
Ker ločljivost 200 x 200 slikovnih točk povsem zadošča za medicinske raziskave, bodo kamero OmniVision OV6948 kmalu pričeli uporabljati za endoskopijo. Tu gre za metodo, kjer zdravniki oziroma specializirani kirurgi s pomočjo kamere pregledujejo površino organov. Novost je namreč opremljena s tehnologijo OmniBSI, ki omogoča prikaz slik tudi v primeru zelo slabe osvetlitve. Zaradi izjemno nizkih stroškov izdelave naj bi bila novost povsem primerna celo za enkratno uporabo.
Kamero OmniVision OV6948 bi morda lahko uporabili celo v avtomobilski industriji. Novost bi lahko koristili tako za vzvratno vožnjo in parkiranje kot bočna ogledala. S tem bi seveda pripomogli k boljši aerodinamičnosti avtomobila in manjši porabi goriva. Ali se bo to dejansko zgodilo, pa je vsaj trenutno težko napovedati.

This is the smallest camera in the world

02 Nov 2019, 11:10











The world's smallest camera, the OmniVision OV6948 measures just 0.575 x 0.575 x 0.232 millimeters.

The American company OmniVision has recently succeeded in something that was recently considered impossible. Their engineers designed an endoscopic camera that is barely larger than a grain of sand. The world's smallest camera, the OmniVision OV6948 measures just 0.575 x 0.575 x 0.232 millimeters and comes with a 40,000 pixel resolution image sensor. The novelty offers a resolution of 200 x 200 pixels and provides an image capture speed of up to 30 frames per second with a 120 degree viewing angle.
Since the resolution of 200 x 200 pixels is sufficient for medical research, the OmniVision OV6948 will soon be used for endoscopy. This is a method where doctors or specialist surgeons scan the surface of the organs using a camera. The new feature is OmniBSI technology, which allows images to be displayed even in extremely low light conditions. Due to the extremely low cost of production, the novelty would be perfectly suited even for single use.
The OmniVision OV6948 may even be used in the automotive industry. The novelty could be used for both reverse and parking and side mirrors. This would, of course, help to improve the aerodynamics of the car and reduce fuel consumption. Whether this will actually happen, however, is difficult to predict at least at the moment.
